title: CREATE TABLE
description: Define a new table
syntax:
CREATE TABLE table_name
(
column_name1 data_type,
column_name2 data_type,
column_name3 data_type,
...
)
example:
CREATE TABLE cat
(
ID int NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
Name varchar(50),
Breed varchar(50),
Ability varchar(50),
Years int,
PRIMARY KEY (CatID)

title: INSERT INTO
description: Create new rows in a table
syntax:
INSERT INTO table_name
VALUES (value1, value2, value3,....)

or

INSERT INTO table_name
(column1, column2, column3,...)
VALUES (value1, value2, value3,....)
example:
INSERT INTO cat (Name,Breed,Ability,Years)
VALUES ('Oreo','Maine Coon','High Jumps',4)

INSERT INTO cat (Name,Breed,Ability,Years)
VALUES ('Lucy','Siberian','Chasing the laser',4)

title: ALTER TABLE
description: Modifies a table definition
syntax:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ADD column_name datatype

or

ALTER TABLE table_name
DROP COLUMN column_name
example:
ALTER TABLE cat
ADD Age int

ALTER TABLE cat
DROP COLUMN Age

title: SELECT
description: Retrieve rows from a table or view
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name 

or SELECT *
FROM table_name

title: WHERE
description: To retrieve specific information from a table excluding other irrelevant data
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE column_name operator value

title: AND
description: Select rows that must satisfy all the given conditions
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE condition
AND condition
example:
SELECT *
FROM cat
WHERE Name='Jack'
AND Breed='Ragdoll'

title: OR
description: Select rows that satisfy atleast one of the given conditions
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE condition
OR condition
example:
SELECT *
FROM cat
WHERE Name='Oreo'
OR Name='Lucy'

title: NOT
description: Select rows that do not satisfy the given condition
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE NOT condition
example:
SELECT *
FROM cat
WHERE NOT Ability='Silence'

title: AS (alias)
description: To temporarily rename a table or a column heading
syntax:
SELECT column_name AS column_alias
FROM table_name

or

SELECT column_name
FROM table_name  AS table_alias
example:
SELECT Name AS [First Name]
FROM cat

SELECT Ability AS Talent
FROM cat

title: BETWEEN..AND..
description: To select values within a range
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE column_name
BETWEEN value1 AND value2
example:
SELECT *
FROM cat
WHERE Years
BETWEEN 4 AND 7

title: GROUP BY
description: To collect data across multiple records and group the results by a column
syntax:
SELECT column_name, aggregate_function(column_name)
FROM table_name
WHERE column_name operator value
GROUP BY column_name
example:
SELECT Breed, COUNT(Name)
FROM cat
WHERE Years=4
GROUP BY Name

title: HAVING
description: To filter data based on the group functions
syntax:
SELECT column_name, aggregate_function(column_name)
FROM table_name
WHERE column_name operator value
GROUP BY column_name
HAVING aggregate_function(column_name) operator value
example:
SELECT Breed, COUNT(Name)
FROM cat
WHERE Years=4
GROUP BY Name
HAVING COUNT(Name) > 1

title: IN
description: To test whether a value is in the list of values provided
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE column_name
IN (value1,value2,..)
example:
SELECT *
FROM cat
WHERE Breed IN ('Maine Coon','Siberian')

title: LIKE
description: To search for a specified pattern in a column
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE column_name LIKE pattern
example:
SELECT *
FROM cat
WHERE Name LIKE '%c%'

title: DISTINCT
description: To return only distinct (different) values in a column
syntax:
SELECT DISTINCT column_name(s)
FROM table_name

title: ORDER BY
description: To sort the records in the result based on a column
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
ORDER BY column_name [ASC|DESC]
example:
SELECT *
FROM cat
ORDER BY Name ASC

SELECT *
FROM cat
ORDER BY Name DESC

title: AVG()
description: Returns the average value of a numeric column
syntax:
SELECT AVG(column_name)
FROM table_name
WHERE condition

title: COUNT()
description: Returns the number of rows that matches a specified criteria
syntax:
SELECT COUNT(column_name)
FROM table_name
WHERE condition

title: MAX()
description: Returns the largest value of the selected column
syntax:
SELECT MAX(column_name)
FROM table_name
WHERE condition

title: MIN()
description: Returns the smallest value of the selected column
syntax:
SELECT MIN(column_name)
FROM table_name
WHERE condition

title: SUM()
description: Returns the total sum of a numeric column
syntax:
SELECT SUM(column_name)
FROM table_name
WHERE condition

title: CREATE VIEW
description: Define a new view
syntax:
CREATE VIEW view_name AS
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE condition
example:
CREATE VIEW [Four Years Old Furs] AS
SELECT *
FROM cat
WHERE Years=4

title: DROP VIEW
description: Remove a view
syntax: DROP VIEW view_name

title: UPDATE
description: Update rows of a table
syntax:
UPDATE table_name
SET column1=value, column2=value,...
WHERE some_column=some_value
example:
UPDATE cat
SET Years=5
WHERE Name='Lucy'

title: CREATE INDEX
description: Define a new table
syntax:
CREATE INDEX index_name
ON table_name (column_name)

or

CREATE UNIQUE INDEX index_name
ON table_name (column_name)

title: DELETE
description: Delete rows of a table
syntax:
DELETE FROM table_name
WHERE some_column=some_value

or

DELETE FROM table_name
(Note: Deletes the entire table!!)

DELETE * FROM table_name
(Note: Deletes the entire table!!)

title: UCASE()
description: Converts a field to upper case
syntax: UCASE(text)

title: LCASE()
description: Converts a field to lower case
syntax: LCASE(text)

title: LEN()
description: Returns the length of a text field
syntax: LEN(text)

title: NOW()
description: Returns the current system date and time
syntax: NOW()

title: TRUNCATE TABLE
description: Empty a table
syntax: TRUNCATE TABLE table_name

title: DROP TABLE
description: Define a new table
syntax: DROP TABLE table_name

title: NOT NULL
description: Enforces a column to not accept NULL values
syntax:
CREATE TABLE table_name
(
column_name1 data_type NOT NULL,
column_name2 data_type NOT NULL,
column_name3 data_type NOT NULL,
...
)

title: EXISTS
description: Used in combination with a subquery and is considered to be met if the subquery returns at least one row
syntax:
IF EXISTS (SELECT * FROM table_name WHERE id = ?)
BEGIN
--do what needs to be done if exists
END
ELSE
BEGIN
--do what needs to be done if not
END

title: SELECT <columns> INTO
description: Create a new table from the results of a query
syntax:
SELECT *
INTO new_table_name [IN externaldatabase]
FROM old_table_name

or

SELECT column_name(s)
INTO new_table_name [IN externaldatabase]
FROM old_table_name

title: INNER JOIN
description: Returns all rows from both tables where there is a match
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
INNER JOIN other_table ON 
other_table.column_name = table_name.reference_column

title: LEFT JOIN
description: Returns all the rows from the first table even if there are no matches in the second table
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
LEFT JOIN other_table ON 
other_table.column_name = table_name.reference_column

title: RIGHT JOIN
description: Returns all the rows from the second table, even if there are no matches in the first table
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
RIGHT JOIN other_table ON 
other_table.column_name = table_name.reference_column

title: FULL JOIN
description: Returns all rows from both tables with nulls in place where the join condition is not met
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
Full OUTER JOIN other_table ON 
other_table.column_name = table_name.reference_column

title: UNION
description: Combines the result of two or more SELECT statements and selects only distinct values
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s) FROM table_name1
UNION
SELECT column_name(s) FROM table_name2

title: UNION ALL
description: Combines the result of two or more SELECT statements and also select duplicate values
syntax:
SELECT column_name(s) FROM table_name1
UNION ALL
SELECT column_name(s) FROM table_name2

title: UNIQUE
description: Ensures that each row for a column must have a unique value
syntax:
CREATE TABLE table_name
(
column_name1 data_type UNIQUE,
column_name2 data_type,
column_name3 data_type,
...
)

title: PRIMARY KEY
description: Combination of NOT NULL and UNIQUE.It uniquely identifies each record in a database table
syntax:
CREATE TABLE table_name
(
column_name1 data_type PRIMARY KEY,
column_name2 data_type,
column_name3 data_type,
...
)

title: FOREIGN KEY
description: Ensure the referential integrity of the data in one table to match values in another table
syntax:
CREATE TABLE table_name
(
column_name1 data_type PRIMARY KEY,
 FOREIGN KEY(column_name2) 
REFERENCES OtherTable(otherTableColumnID), 
column_name3 data_type,
...
)

title: DEFAULT
description: Specifies a default value for a column
syntax:
CREATE TABLE table_name
(
column_name1 data_type DEFAULT defaultValue,
column_name2 data_type,
column_name3 data_type,
...
)

title: MID()
description: Extract characters from a text field
syntax: MID(text)

title: ROUND()
description: Rounds a numeric field to the number of decimals specified
syntax: ROUND(integer)

title: FORMAT()
description: Formats how a field is to be displayed
syntax: FORMAT(value, format, culture)
